item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Manny Ramirez, David Ortiz tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs in 2003
item.description: Manny Ramirez and David Ortiz tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs in 2003, lawyers with knowledge of the results told The New York Times.

item.dc:creator: J.A. Adande and Marc Stein
item.title: Source: Lamar Odom will return to the Los Angeles Lakers
item.description: Lamar Odom will return to the Los Angeles Lakers, according to an NBA source.

item.dc:creator: Buster Olney
item.title: Roy Halladay trade talks are dead, Toronto Blue Jays GM says
item.description: Trade talks for Toronto ace Roy Halladay are "dead," but the club remains willing to listen to offers leading up to Friday's deadline, Blue Jays general manager J.P Ricciardi said in an e-mail Thursday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Arturo Gatti's death ruled suicide; wife released
item.description: Brazilian police say the death of boxer Arturo Gatti was a suicide and a court has ordered the release of his wife.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Vick says he's 'getting close' to finding team
item.description: Michael Vick says he is getting close to signing with a team but had no other details for reporters after a bankruptcy hearing in Virginia.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Oakland Raiders agree to five-year, $23.5 million contract with receiver Darrius Heyward-Bey
item.description: Rookie receiver Darrius Heyward-Bey agreed with the Raiders on a five-year contract that will guarantee him at least $23.5 million.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Antonio Pierce of New York Giants testifying before grand jury
item.description: New York Giants linebacker Antonio Pierce is testifying before the grand jury investigating a gun charge against Plaxico Burress.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Greg McMackin, Hawaii Warriors' football coach, uses homosexual slur in reference to Notre Dame Fighting Irish dance prior to Hawaii Bowl
item.description: Hawaii football coach Greg McMackin used a homosexual slur in describing a dance performed by Notre Dame players at a banquet prior to the teams' meeting in the 2008 Hawaii Bowl.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Buick Open: Tiger Woods' putting puts him in trouble; Steve Lowery in lead
item.description: Tiger Woods says one of the worst putting days of his career led to a lackluster 1-under 71 at the Buick Open.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: U.S. swimmer Ryan Lochte breaks Michael Phelps' record in 200 individual medley at world championships
item.description: With Michael Phelps cheering from the stands, Ryan Lochte of the United States set a world record in the 200-meter individual medley at the world championships.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: New York Mets general manager Omar Minaya says he apologized to NY Daily News writer Adam Rubin
item.description: Mets general manager Omar Minaya says he apologized to a beat reporter for his critical comments during a bizarre news conference

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Kenechi Udeze retires, ends comeback from leukemia
item.description: Minnesota Vikings defensive end Kenechi Udeze has decided to retire, ending a remarkable comeback from leukemia.

item.dc:creator: Jon Greenberg
item.title: MLB trade: Chicago Cubs trade for Pittsburgh Pirates pitchers John Grabow and Tom Gorzelanny
item.description: MLB trade: Chicago Cubs trade for Pittsburgh Pirates pitchers John Grabow and Tom Gorzelanny.
